question: If all birds can fly, and sparrows are birds, which of the following must be true?

answers.text: Some birds cannot fly.
Sparrows can fly.
All sparrows can swim.
All birds are sparrows.
Only sparrows can fly.

question: A new study finds that cities with more public parks have lower crime rates. Which of the following, if true, most weakens the conclusion that building more parks reduces crime?

answers.text: Crime rates are higher in cities with fewer green spaces.
Some parks are located in unsafe areas.
Parks provide places for people to gather.
Cities with more parks also have higher employment rates.
Park maintenance costs are high.

question: If no dogs are cats and all cats are mammals, which of the following must be true?

answers.text: All dogs are cats.
Some mammals are dogs.
No dogs are cats.
No cats are mammals.
No dogs are mammals.

question: Our company should switch to remote work because employees will be happier and productivity will increase. Which of the following is an assumption required by the argument?

answers.text: Employees dislike commuting.
Remote work always improves productivity.
Managers prefer working remotely.
Happiness and productivity are linked.
Employees will have access to reliable internet at home.

question: All professional chefs are good cooks. James is a good cook. Therefore, James is a professional chef. Which of the following best describes the flaw?

answers.text: It assumes cause and effect are the same.
It assumes that all good cooks must be professional chefs.
It ignores other factors.
It confuses necessary and sufficient conditions.
It assumes James went to culinary school.

question: A survey showed that people who drank coffee every day reported higher alertness. Therefore, drinking coffee every day causes higher alertness. Which of the following most weakens the conclusion?

answers.text: Many people like the taste of coffee.
Alertness levels vary during the day.
People who are naturally alert are more likely to drink coffee.
Coffee drinking is a common habit.
Coffee contains caffeine, a stimulant.

question: A movie reviewer writes: 'This movie is bad because it is terrible.' Which logical fallacy is present?

answers.text: Circular reasoning
False cause
Ad hominem
False dilemma
Straw man

question: Which one of the following statements is logically equivalent to 'If it snows, then school will close'?

answers.text: School closes if and only if it snows.
If school closes, it snowed.
Snow is the only reason for school to close.
School will never close unless it snows.
If school does not close, then it did not snow.

question: A politician argues: 'We should not increase taxes because higher taxes are bad.' Which flaw is present in this argument?

answers.text: It appeals to authority.
It attacks the person instead of the issue.
It assumes the conclusion in its premise.
It draws a false analogy.
It overgeneralizes from one example.

question: Some athletes are musicians. All musicians are creative. Therefore, some athletes are creative. Which of the following describes the reasoning?

answers.text: Invalid, because not all athletes are musicians.
Valid only if all athletes are musicians.
Invalid, because creativity is unrelated to athletics.
Invalid, because musicians cannot be athletes.
Valid, because at least some athletes who are musicians are creative.

question: A company implemented flexible work hours and found higher productivity. Which of the following, if true, most weakens the claim that flexible work hours cause higher productivity?

answers.text: The company also introduced performance bonuses at the same time.
Productivity was already rising.
Employees like flexible work arrangements.
Other companies without flexible hours have lower productivity.
Employees appreciated the new policy.

question: Which of the following arguments commits the flaw of confusing correlation with causation?

answers.text: People who eat breakfast daily tend to weigh less, so eating breakfast causes weight loss.
All cats are animals.
If it rains, the streets get wet.
Some birds migrate south in winter.
All mammals need oxygen to live, and humans are mammals, so humans need oxygen.

question: Most students who study at night perform better on exams. Which of the following must be assumed for this argument to hold?

answers.text: Other factors like prior knowledge do not affect performance.
Students who study during the day do not perform well.
Nighttime study sessions are more effective than daytime ones.
All students can stay awake late at night.
Teachers encourage night studying.

question: Which of the following is the contrapositive of 'If someone is a teacher, then they are educated'?

answers.text: If someone is not educated, then they are not a teacher.
Only teachers are educated.
If someone is educated, then they are a teacher.
If someone is not a teacher, they might still be educated.
If someone is not a teacher, then they are not educated.

question: Which of the following best completes the argument? 'All new employees must attend training. Sarah is a new employee, so _____.'

answers.text: Sarah cannot attend training.
Training is optional for Sarah.
Sarah might attend training.
Sarah will train only if she wants to.
Sarah must attend training.

question: No books on this shelf are novels. All novels are fiction. Therefore, which of the following must be true?

answers.text: All fiction books are on this shelf.
All books on this shelf are novels.
No books on this shelf are fiction.
Some books on this shelf are fiction.
Some fiction books are not novels.

question: Which of the following arguments is valid?

answers.text: All doctors are scientists. Emily is a scientist. Therefore, Emily is a doctor.
Some students are athletes. John is an athlete. Therefore, John is a student.
All cats are animals. Fluffy is an animal. Therefore, Fluffy is a cat.
All dogs are pets. Max is not a pet. Therefore, Max is a dog.
All squares are rectangles. This shape is a square. Therefore, this shape is a rectangle.

question: A store raised prices but saw higher sales revenue. Which of the following best explains this?

answers.text: Competitors lowered prices significantly.
The store had fewer customers than before.
The store's products are luxury items, and higher prices suggest higher quality.
Customers decided to shop elsewhere.
Customers dislike price increases.

question: A study found that students who take notes by hand remember more information than those who type notes. Which of the following best explains this?

answers.text: Handwritten notes are difficult to read.
Typing notes saves time.
Students who type notes type faster.
Students who write notes process information more deeply.
Students who type notes are more tech-savvy.

question: A company claims: 'Our product is the best because no other product is better.' Which flaw is present?

answers.text: False analogy
Begging the question
Appeal to authority
Faulty generalization
Straw man

question: If all lawyers are professionals and some professionals are teachers, which statement must be true?

answers.text: Some professionals are lawyers.
No professionals are lawyers.
No lawyers are teachers.
Some lawyers are teachers.
All teachers are lawyers.

question: Which of the following arguments is most similar in reasoning to: 'All roses are flowers. Some flowers fade quickly. Therefore, some roses fade quickly.'

answers.text: All cars are vehicles. Some vehicles are red. Therefore, all cars are red.
All birds can fly. Some insects can fly. Therefore, some birds are insects.
All squares are shapes. Some shapes are circles. Therefore, some squares are circles.
All people are humans. Some humans are doctors. Therefore, all people are doctors.
All mammals are animals. Some animals are large. Therefore, some mammals are large.

question: Which of the following best identifies a necessary assumption in the argument? 'Introducing a reading program will improve literacy rates in the city.'

answers.text: The reading program will be effectively implemented.
Other cities have used similar programs.
Everyone in the city will attend the program.
The city has a high illiteracy rate.
The program is inexpensive.

question: Which of the following, if true, most strengthens the claim: 'Eating more vegetables improves overall health'?

answers.text: Doctors recommend eating vegetables.
People enjoy eating vegetables.
A long-term study found people who ate more vegetables had fewer health problems.
Vegetables are low in calories.

question: A student claims: 'I failed my exam because I didn't study enough.' Which of the following is an alternative explanation?

answers.text: The student forgot to set an alarm.
The exam was graded unfairly.
The exam was difficult for everyone.
The student did not attend class.
All of the above.

question: Which of the following best illustrates a false dilemma?

answers.text: This medicine worked for my friend, so it must work for me.
Some people are allergic to peanuts.
You either support this law or you are against progress.

If it rains, the ground will be wet.

question: Most successful businesses invest in advertising. Therefore, advertising guarantees success. Which flaw is committed?

answers.text: Confusing cause with correlation
Appeal to popularity
False analogy

question: Which of the following is logically equivalent to: 'No students who failed the exam received an A in the class'?

question: All actors are artists. Some artists are painters. Which of the following must be true?

answers.text: Some painters are actors.
All artists are actors.

question: If the car does not start, then either the battery is dead or there is no fuel. Which of the following is logically equivalent?

answers.text: The car will start if the battery is dead or there is fuel.
If there is no fuel, the battery must be dead.
If the battery is dead, the car will start.
If the battery is not dead and there is fuel, then the car will start.
